Sets or queries the difficulty level (peaceful, easy, etc.).

== Usage ==
On a multiplayer server difficulty lasts only until the server is restarted — on restart, difficulty is reloaded from [[server.properties]]. 

In [[Hardcore]] mode, the difficulty doesn't change even when successful.{{only|java}}

== Syntax ==
* '''Java Edition'''
: <code>difficulty [peaceful|easy|normal|hard]</code>

* '''Bedrock Edition'''
: <code>difficulty <difficulty: Difficulty></code>
: <code>difficulty <difficulty: int></code>

== Arguments ==
{{el|je|short=1}}: {{code|peaceful{{!}}easy{{!}}normal{{!}}hard}}<br>
{{el|be|short=1}}: {{argument|be=1|difficulty: Difficulty|enum}} and {{argument|be=1|difficulty: int|int}}
: Specifies the new difficulty level. Must be one of the following:
:* <code>peaceful</code> (can be abbreviated as <code>p</code> or <code>0</code>{{only|bedrock}}) for [[Peaceful]] difficulty
:* <code>easy</code> (can be abbreviated as <code>e</code> or <code>1</code>{{only|bedrock}}) for [[Easy]] difficulty
:* <code>normal</code> (can be abbreviated as <code>n</code> or <code>2</code>{{only|bedrock}}) for [[Normal]] difficulty
:* <code>hard</code> (can be abbreviated as <code>h</code> or <code>3</code>{{only|bedrock}}) for [[Hard]] difficulty
: If unspecified, queries the current difficulty instead of changing it.{{only|java}}

== Examples ==
* To change the difficulty to hard: <code>difficulty hard</code>, <code>difficulty h</code>{{only|bedrock}}, or <code>difficulty 3</code>{{only|bedrock}}
